page.title: 08Nature of Work in The Lee
page.content: By far the largest employer in The Lee is the building firm of Humphreys Bros. est. in 1922. They employ 20 men, including 3 apprentices and 1 YOP trainee. They specialise in high class residential work within a 10 mile radius. 50% of materials used are second hand from demolition sites. The vast majority of the people employed in farming are owners or tenant farmers; the Manor estate has a manager & 2 others for both agricultural & forestry purposes. Much work is undertaken by contract workers. Many people work outside the area. The professions are well represented; there are 5 doctors, as well as bank managers, solicitors, teachers etc. There are several people engaged in the media, especially television.
